3.  Grant of License in the Trademarks
3.1 License. Subject to the terms of this Agreement (including all obligations to first obtain Franchisor’s written approval),
Franchisor hereby grants to Franchisee the right to use the Trademarks (the details of which are set out in Exhibit A to this Agreement) (including
sub-licensing this right to third party franchisees with the approval of Franchisor), on a royalty-free basis, for the purpose of operating and
promoting the Smaaash Centres in the Territory. Franchisee is, in particular entitled to:
(a) offer, market and/or distribute any products and services in connection with the Smaaash Centres under the Trademarks; and

perturbation.explanation: The phrase '(the details of which are set out in Exhibit A to this Agreement)' was removed from Section 3.1. This creates an inconsistency because the agreement refers to Exhibit A as containing trademark details, but Exhibit A might not exist or might contain completely unrelated data. Other parts of the contract that mention Exhibit A will now be ambiguous, since the exhibit is referenced but its content is not clearly defined or accessible within the document itself.
